description: Deep spatial analysis of Hong Kong OSM data.

turns.query: Identify the district with the worst 'Food Swamp Index'. Calculate the index for each district as: Count(Fast Food) / (Count(Fast Food) + Count(Supermarket)). Find the district with the highest index value. Store the result as a tuple (district_name, index_value) in the variable 'worst_food_swamp'

Evaluate the functional diversity of the 'Central and Western' district. Calculate the Shannon Entropy of the 'category' distribution for POIs in that district. Store the result in 'diversity_entropy'.

Analyze the spatial clustering of coffee shops. Filter for category='cafe'. Calculate the Euclidean distance in meters from each cafe to its nearest *other* cafe neighbor. Store the average of these nearest neighbor distances in 'avg_nn_dist'.

Find the 'Most Competitive Node'. For every POI in the dataset, count how many *other* POIs of the *same category* exist within a Euclidean radius of 0.005 degrees. Identify the POI ID with the highest count and store it in 'most_competitive_id'.

Assess the 'Fast Food Exposure' for schools. For each school, identify all 'fast_food' POIs located within a 0.005 degree radius. Calculate an exposure score by summing the inverse distances (1/distance_in_meters) to these nearby fast food spots. Identify the school with the highest exposure score. Store the result as a tuple (school_id, score) in 'riskiest_school'.
